revised_title: Investigating the Voltaic Action of Phosphorus, Sulphur, and Hydrocarbons
tldr: The author explores the voltaic action of phosphorus, sulphur, and hydrocarbons in gas voltaic batteries, discovering that phosphorus can act as a permanent voltaic excitant when combined with nitrogen and oxygen. This finding demonstrates the first instance of a solid, insoluble non-conductor being used to excite a continuous voltaic current.
